definition: kun 鯤|鲲[kun1] and peng 鵬|鹏[Peng2], mythological beasts/peng, a gigantic bird transformed from the kun
fry (newly hatched fish)/legendary giant fish that could transform into a giant bird 鵬|鹏[Peng2]
Peng, large fabulous bird/roc
lit. the giant Peng bird spreads its wings and begins to fly/displaying awesome power and momentum at the outset/to have the world at one's feet

sentences.english: After Yang Kunpeng absents , can the rear guard line need to transform greatly.
sentences.chinese: 杨鲲鹏缺席后，中能后防线需要大改造。

sentences.english: The report said the carrier was unprofitable.
sentences.chinese: 报道说，鲲鹏航空没有实现盈利。

sentences.english: Sometimes dream soaring above the earth like a roc.
sentences.chinese: 有时候，梦想像鲲鹏一样，展翅高飞。

definition: oriental greenfinch (Carduelis sinica)
roc (mythical bird of prey)/great talent
three-legged Golden Crow that lives in the sun (in northeast Asian and Chinese mythology)/Korean: samjog'o
Golden Crow/the sun/the three-legged golden crow that lives in the sun
roc (mythical bird of prey)
a legendary dragon with the ability to control rain and floods/see also 蛟龍|蛟龙[jiao1 long2]
Dijun, Shang dynasty protector God, possibly same as legendary Emperor 帝嚳|帝喾[Di4 Ku4]
Pangu (creator of the universe in Chinese mythology)
legendary dragon with the ability to control rain and floods
Bai Ze or White Marsh, legendary creature of ancient China

clear sky
